		<symbol id="icon-checked" viewBox="0 0 32 32">
			<title>checked</title>
			<path class="path1" fill="#e7eced" d="M0 0h32v32h-32v-32z"></path>
			<path class="path2" fill="none" stroke="#424a60" stroke-width="1.1034" stroke-miterlimit="10" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round" d="M23.172 11.034l-8.828 9.931-5.517-4.414"></path>
		</symbol>
		<symbol id="icon-facebook" viewBox="0 0 32 32">
			<title>facebook</title>
			<path class="path1" d="M27.688 0h-23.376c-2.381 0-4.312 1.931-4.312 4.312v23.376c0 2.382 1.931 4.312 4.312 4.312h11.529l0.020-11.435h-2.971c-0.386 0-0.699-0.312-0.701-0.698l-0.014-3.686c-0.002-0.388 0.313-0.704 0.701-0.704h2.965v-3.562c0-4.133 2.524-6.384 6.211-6.384h3.026c0.387 0 0.701 0.314 0.701 0.701v3.108c0 0.387-0.314 0.701-0.701 0.701l-1.857 0.001c-2.005 0-2.393 0.953-2.393 2.351v3.083h4.406c0.42 0 0.746 0.367 0.696 0.784l-0.437 3.686c-0.042 0.353-0.341 0.619-0.696 0.619h-3.949l-0.020 11.435h6.86c2.381 0 4.312-1.931 4.312-4.312v-23.376c-0-2.382-1.931-4.312-4.312-4.312z"></path>
		</symbol>
		<symbol id="icon-sort" viewBox="0 0 64 64">
			<title>sort</title>
			<path d="M27.077 7.385h-24.615c-1.477 0-2.462 0.985-2.462 2.462v4.923c0 1.477 0.985 2.462 2.462 2.462h24.615c1.477 0 2.462-0.985 2.462-2.462v-4.923c0-1.477-0.985-2.462-2.462-2.462z"></path>
			<path d="M27.077 27.077h-24.615c-1.477 0-2.462 0.985-2.462 2.462v4.923c0 1.477 0.985 2.462 2.462 2.462h24.615c1.477 0 2.462-0.985 2.462-2.462v-4.923c0-1.477-0.985-2.462-2.462-2.462z"></path>
			<path d="M27.077 46.769h-24.615c-1.477 0-2.462 0.985-2.462 2.462v4.923c0 1.477 0.985 2.462 2.462 2.462h24.615c1.477 0 2.462-0.985 2.462-2.462v-4.923c0-1.477-0.985-2.462-2.462-2.462z"></path>
			<path d="M63.262 37.662l-3.446-3.446c-0.492-0.492-1.231-0.738-1.723-0.738-0.738 0-1.231 0.246-1.723 0.738l-4.923 4.923c-0.738 0.738-2.215 0.246-2.215-0.985v-33.231c0-1.231-1.231-2.462-2.462-2.462h-4.923c-1.231 0-2.462 1.231-2.462 2.462v54.154c0 0.738 0.246 1.231 0.738 1.723s1.231 0.738 1.723 0.738c0.738 0 1.231-0.246 1.723-0.738l19.692-19.692c0.492-0.492 0.738-0.985 0.738-1.723s-0.246-1.231-0.738-1.723z"></path>
		</symbol>
	</defs>
</svg>    
	<div id="searchOuter" class="flexcenter searchOuter initial">

		<div class="tooltip_templates">
		    <div id="download_tt">
		    	<div class="dialog_input">
		    		<div class="prompt">
						<form>

	<div class="pageblock lightblue">
		
	    <div id="maincontainer" class="container justify">
		<div class="intro row">
			<div class="center col-12">
				<h1>Sonar: The Free Amazon Keyword Research Tool from <a href="https://sellics.com" onClick="ga('send', 'event', { eventCategory: 'Sellics Referrals', eventAction: 'Click', eventLabel: 'Footer Headline ZH'});">Sellics</a></h1>
  				<p>Amazon keyword research done with real data from actual customer search queries</p>
			</div>
		</div>

		<div class="row">
			<div class="col-6">
				<div class="db_count">
					<div id="kw_c">00.000.000</div> <svg class="icon icon-united-states"><use xlink:href="#icon-united-states"></use></svg> Keywords
				</div>
			</div>
			<div class="col-6">
				<div class="db_count">
					<div id="pd_c">00.000.000</div> <svg class="icon icon-united-states"><use xlink:href="#icon-united-states"></use></svg> Products
				</div>
			</div>
		</div>

		<div class="row">
			<div class="col-6">
				<h3>
					How does the Sonar Amazon Keyword Tool work?
				</h3>
				<p>All keyword suggestions in Sonar are based only on real search queries of Amazon shoppers. Using complex algorithms we can detect what shoppers are searching for on Amazon and collect the search terms in our database. Sources other than Amazon itself (e.g. Google) aren’t taken into account as the search behaviour differs significantly; This way, we can make sure that the only Amazon keywords recommended are ones that are relevant to Amazon..
				</p>
			</div>
			<div class="col-6">
				<h3>
					How can I optimize my keywords with the Sonar Amazon Keyword Tool?
				</h3>
				<p>Keyword optimization on Amazon is comprised of two steps: In the first, thorough Amazon keyword research must be conducted to find all relevant keywords. This can be done quickly and easily with an Amazon keyword tool like Sonar. In the second step, the researched keywords have to be added to the Amazon product. You can find tips on keyword optimization in our blog - including <a href="https://sellics.com/blog-amazon-keyword-repetition-do-or-dont" onClick="ga('send', 'event', { eventCategory: 'Sellics Referrals', eventAction: 'Click', eventLabel: 'Footer FAQ Content US'});">case studies</a> on the effect of keyword placement on listing visibility.
				</p>
			</div>
		</div>

<!--added 23.03.2017-->
		<div class="row">
			<div class="col-12">
				<h3>
				How does the ASIN Reverse-Lookup work and why does Sonar not display keywords for some products?

				</h3>
			</div>
			<div class="col-6">
				<p><em>1. Database - Not a Live Query</em><br/> Sonar is a huge database of product/keyword combinations. Sonar currently updates
				on a irregular basis.
				<br/> If the respective product is relatively new on Amazon, it may not yet be part of the database.
				</p>
			</div>
			<div class="col-6">
				<p>
				<em> 2. Only Well Ranking Keywords</em><br/> Sonar only includes keywords for which the ASIN is ranking on the first page
				of the searchresults (or at least was ranked at the time of the last database update). The ASIN Reverse Search therefore
				offers a good opportunity to find out the keywords with which any given ASIN is generating most of its (organic) sales.
				</p>
			</div>
		</div>


		<div class="row">
			<div class="col-6">
				<h3>
Is there a reverse ASIN lookup to discover competitor keywords with Sonar?
				</h3>
				<p>
Yes, just enter the ASIN of a competitor product and start the search. Sonar will automatically recognize the ASIN and give you the keywords your competitor is ranking for, so that you can discover the keywords he uses.

				</p>
			</div>
			<div class="col-6">
				<h3>
What is the difference between Sonar and other tools like Merchant Words or Keyword Inspector?
				</h3>
				<p>
Compared to other Amazon keyword tools like Merchantwords and Keywordinspector, Sonar offers a comprehensive set of features like ASIN reverse lookup, extended search to find synonymous keywords, Amazon search volume as well as unlimited use and downloads but is 100% free.
				</p>
			</div>

			

		</div>

		<div class="row">
			<div class="col-6">
				<h3>
				What do the PPC signs indicate in the ASIN search?
				</h3>
				<p>At the time of the last Sonar database update the entered ASIN appeared on the first page of the searchresults for the specific keyword as a result of PPC ads (Pay per Click).</p>
			</div>
			<div class="col-6">
				<h3>Troubleshoot - Why is Sonar not loading anything?</h3>
				<p>Please make sure you don't have any kind of Javascript Blockers installed in your browser. Also, if you are using a company network with anything but the standard port (80), it may cause issues.
				</p>
			</div>
		</div>

		
<!--/added 23.03.2017-->

		<div class="row">
			<div class="col-6">
				<h3>
					How does Sonar calculate search volume of keywords on Amazon?
				</h3>
				<p>
					Because Amazon itself doesn’t provide any information on search volume, the Amazon search volumes in Sonar are based on our own research from our own algorithm. With the help of complex calculations for probability of appearance as well as many other diverse key figures, Amazon search volume can be calculated for every keyword..
				</p>
			</div>
			<div class="col-6">
				<h3>
					Which other Amazon Keyword Analyses should be conducted?
				</h3>
				<p>
					After successfully finishing Amazon keyword research and product optimization, it’s recommended to observe ranking development of the optimized keywords. This is the only way to be sure that the optimizations you’ve done have actually lead to an improvement in rankings. You can track the rankings of your keywords easily - and every day - with the <a href="https://sellics.com" onClick="ga('send', 'event', { eventCategory: 'Sellics Referrals', eventAction: 'Click', eventLabel: 'Footer FAQ Homepage US'});">Ranking Tracker from Sellics</a>.
				</p>
			</div>
		</div>

		<div class="row">
			<div class="col-6">
				<h3>
					Can Sonar be used for Kindle and E-Book Keywords too?
				</h3>
				<p>Yes! You can also research Amazon keywords for Kindle and ebooks. The keyword database contains all search queries that have been entered into Amazon in all product categories.
				</p>
			</div>
			<div class="col-6">
				<h3>
					Which Amazon Marketplaces does the keyword tool cover?
				</h3>
				<p>
					Right now, Sonar covers the largest Amazon markets: Germany and USA. However, the remaining marketplaces will follow soon. Find out about it first by signing up to the <a href="https://sellics.com/newsletter-signup" onClick="ga('send', 'event', { eventCategory: 'Sellics Referrals', eventAction: 'Click', eventLabel: 'Footer FAQ Newsletter US'});">Sellics Newsletter</a>
				</p>
			</div>
		</div>

		<div class="row">
			<div class="col-6">
				<h3>
					Extra Amazon keyword optimization tips
				</h3>
				<p>The most important (and relevant) keywords should be placed in the product listing’s title in order to maximize visibility for these keywords. For more information on listing optimization, check out this comprehensive <a href="http://www.sellics.com/amazon-seo" onClick="ga('send', 'event', { eventCategory: 'Sellics Referrals', eventAction: 'Click', eventLabel: 'Footer FAQ Content US'});">Complete Guide to Amazon SEO</a>. And if you want to find Amazon PPC keywords, Sonar is great for that too. It’d be smart to read up on the <a href="https://sellics.com/category/amazon-sponsored-products" onClick="ga('send', 'event', { eventCategory: 'Sellics Referrals', eventAction: 'Click', eventLabel: 'Footer FAQ Content US'});">Sponsored Product Tips in the Sellics blog</a> for ways to find new keywords for your campaigns.
				</p>
			</div>
			<div class="col-6">
				<h3>
					The Ultimate Amazon Keyword Generator
				</h3>
				<p>
					Keywords are a requirement for a product to even be found at all in Amazon’s search results. A product will appear in search results only when all keywords of a customer’s search query are contained in the listing. Keywords, therefore, are a decisive factor for visibility and also traffic to a listing page. Want to know more about the role of keywords in <a href="https://sellics.com/amazon-seo" onClick="ga('send', 'event', { eventCategory: 'Sellics Referrals', eventAction: 'Click', eventLabel: 'Footer FAQ Content US'});">Amazon SEO</a>? Check out the Sellics blog here.
				</p>
			</div>
		</div>
	</div><!-- // #maincontainer -->
	</div>
	
	<section class="conversionblock pageblock">
		<div class="container">
			<div class="row">
				<div class="col-12 center">
					<div class="lead">Like this free Amazon keyword research tool?</div>
					<h1>Try <b>Sellics</b>: Our All-in-One Amazon Software for Professional Sellers and Vendors</h1>
					<div>

								</div>
							</li>

								<div>

					</div>
					<div class="pad20">

						14 Day Free Trial
					</a>
					<div class="text-smaller pad20">
						No credit card required! More information at <a href="https://sellics.com" onClick="ga('send', 'event', { eventCategory: 'Sellics Referrals', eventAction: 'Click', eventLabel: 'Footer Conversion Button Clear Link US'});">sellics.com</a>
					</div>
				</div>
			</div>
		</div>
	</section><!-- // conversionblock -->

	{{/each}}
	<section id="downloadblock" class="downloadblock blockhidden">

<script id="kw__template_ppcpotential" type="text/x-handlebars-template">
		{{#each this}}
		<li class="{{opened}}">
			<span class="rating r{{rating}}" title="Search-Volume (min=1,max=5)">
				<div class="bar"/><div class="bar"/><div class="bar"/><div class="bar"/><div class="bar"/>
			</span>
			{{#equal ppclevel 1}}
				<span class="ppc {{ppc}} level-{{ppclevel}}" title="there is potential in PPC on this keyword">
					<div>PPC <i class="fa fa-flag" aria-hidden="true"></i></div>
				</span>
			{{/equal}}
			{{#equal ppclevel 2}}
				<span class="ppc {{ppc}} level-{{ppclevel}}" title="there is less potential in PPC on this keyword">
					<div>PPC</div>
				</span>
			{{/equal}}
			<div class="text {{opened}}">{{title}}</div>
		</li>
		{{/each}}
		<section id="downloadblock" class="downloadblock blockhidden">
			<div class="frame center">

				<p>
					The leading Amazon Optimization Software for Amazon SEO, PPC Campaigns, Profit Analysis, Review Management and more.

						<div class="subline">No Credit Card Required</div>

<script id="conversionBoxSmall_template" type="text/x-handlebars-template" onClick="ga('send', 'event', { eventCategory: ' MPA Referrals', eventAction: 'Click', eventLabel: 'Search Results Conversion Button DE'});">
	<li class="conversionInsert">
		<a class="button small" href="https://sellics.com/" target="_blank">Start free trial
			<svg class="icon icon-arrow_right"><use xlink:href="#icon-arrow_right"></use></svg> </a>

</script>    <script src="http://sonar-tool.com/themes/sonar/assets/javascript/vendor.js"></script>
	<script src="http://sonar-tool.com/themes/sonar/assets/javascript/vendor.ext.js"></script>

	<script>
    // Default values
	var currentLang = 'us';
	var searchMarket = 'us';
	var searchSort = 'R';

	var searchLang = 'en';
	
	// check if param is there and set it
	let newMarket = '';
	//console.log(newMarket !== '');
	if (newMarket !== "") {
	    searchMarket = newMarket;
    }
</script>
	<script src="http://sonar-tool.com/themes/sonar/assets/javascript/main.js"></script>
	
	<script type="text/javascript">
    var fxcontinue = true;
    try {
		/* ========== CONF ==========*/
        var MESH = {
        	w: 3000,
        	h: 1600,
        	xSlices: 20,
        	ySlices: 12,
        	depth: 19,
        	xRange: 0.04,
        	yRange: 0.22,
        	zRange: 0.5,
        	speed: 0.0003,
        	color1: '#BBBBBB',
        	color2: '#448ac7'
        };
        
        var LIGHT = {
        	xyScalar: 1,
        	zOffset: 100,
        	bounds: FSS.Vector3.create(),
        	color1: '#448ac7',
        	color2: '#448ac7'
        };
        
        var container = document.getElementById('fx-container');
        /* ========== END ===========*/
        
        var renderer = new FSS.CanvasRenderer();
        var scene = new FSS.Scene();
        var light = new FSS.Light(LIGHT.color1, LIGHT.color2);
        var geometry = new FSS.Plane(MESH.w, MESH.h, MESH.xSlices, MESH.ySlices);
        var material = new FSS.Material(MESH.color1, MESH.color2);
        var mesh = new FSS.Mesh(geometry, material);
        var now, start = Date.now();
        
        var center = FSS.Vector3.create();
        var attractor = FSS.Vector3.create();
        
        // Augment vertices for animation
        var v, vertex;
        for (v = geometry.vertices.length - 1; v >= 0; v--) {
        	vertex = geometry.vertices[v];
        	vertex.anchor = FSS.Vector3.clone(vertex.position);
        	vertex.step = FSS.Vector3.create(
        		Math.randomInRange(0.2, 1.0),
        		Math.randomInRange(0.2, 1.0),
        		Math.randomInRange(0.2, 1.0)
        	);
        	vertex.time = Math.randomInRange(0, Math.PIM2);
        }
        function update() {
        	var ox, oy, oz, l, light, v, vertex, offset = MESH.depth/2;
        
        	// Update Bounds
        	FSS.Vector3.copy(LIGHT.bounds, center);
        	FSS.Vector3.multiplyScalar(LIGHT.bounds, LIGHT.xyScalar);
        
        	// Update Attractor
        	FSS.Vector3.setZ(attractor, LIGHT.zOffset);
        
        	// Animate Vertices
        	for (v = geometry.vertices.length - 1; v >= 0; v--) {
        		vertex = geometry.vertices[v];
        		ox = Math.sin(vertex.time + vertex.step[0] * now * MESH.speed);
        		oy = Math.cos(vertex.time + vertex.step[1] * now * MESH.speed);
        		oz = Math.sin(vertex.time + vertex.step[2] * now * MESH.speed);
        		FSS.Vector3.set(vertex.position,
        			MESH.xRange*geometry.segmentWidth*ox,
        			MESH.yRange*geometry.sliceHeight*oy,
        			MESH.zRange*offset*oz - offset);
        		FSS.Vector3.add(vertex.position, vertex.anchor);
        	}
        
        	if (fxcontinue) {
        		requestAnimationFrame(update);
        	}
        
        	// Set the Geometry to dirty
        	geometry.dirty = true;
        }
        
        //****************************
        
        function initialise() {
        	scene.add(mesh);
        	scene.add(light);
        	container.appendChild(renderer.element);
        	window.addEventListener('resize', resize);
        }
        
        function resize() {
        	renderer.setSize(container.offsetWidth, container.offsetHeight);
        }
        
        function animate() {
        	now = Date.now() - start;
        	light.setPosition(300*Math.sin(now*0.001), 200*Math.cos(now*0.0005), 60);
        	renderer.render(scene);
        
        	if (fxcontinue) {
        		requestAnimationFrame(animate);
        	}
        }
        
        initialise();
        resize();
        animate();
        update();
	} catch(e) {

	}
</script>
    <!-- Manual Google Analytics integration -->
<script>
	(function(i,s,o,g,r,a,m){i['GoogleAnalyticsObject']=r;i[r]=i[r]||function(){
			(i[r].q=i[r].q||[]).push(arguments)},i[r].l=1*new Date();a=s.createElement(o),
		m=s.getElementsByTagName(o)[0];a.async=1;a.src=g;m.parentNode.insertBefore(a,m)
	})(window,document,'script','https://www.google-analytics.com/analytics.js','ga');

	ga('create', 'UA-47224701-6', 'auto');
	ga('send', 'pageview');

</script>
<!-- END Manual Google Analytics integration -->

<!-- Drip Integration -->
<script type="text/javascript">
	var _dcq = _dcq || [];
	var _dcs = _dcs || {};
	_dcs.account = '3465490';

	(function() {
		var dc = document.createElement('script');
		dc.type = 'text/javascript'; dc.async = true;
		dc.src = '//tag.getdrip.com/3465490.js';
		var s = document.getElementsByTagName('script')[0];
		s.parentNode.insertBefore(dc, s);
	})();
</script>
<!-- Mouseflow Integration -->
<script type="text/javascript">
	var _mfq = _mfq || [];
	(function() {
	var mf = document.createElement("script");
	mf.type = "text/javascript"; mf.async = true;
	mf.src = "//cdn.mouseflow.com/projects/bced33a9-c7e6-409a-8ab0-184c9f6a661e.js";
	document.getElementsByTagName("head")[0].appendChild(mf);
	})();
</script>

<!-- Facebook Integration -->
<script>
$(window).load(function() {
	window.fbAsyncInit = function() {
		FB.init({
			appId      : '1194232317321068',
			xfbml      : true,
			version    : 'v2.8'
		});
		FB.AppEvents.logPageView();
	};

});
</script>
